text: Muqattaâ€˜at, which in Arabic means abbreviated or shortened  letters, are  symbolic  letter  combinations. They appear respectively at the beginning 29 chapters of the Quran in the form of Alif  Lam Mim, Ha Mim, Nun, Ayn Sin, Qaf, etc. They also appear as  chapter names, such as Ta Ha, Ya Sin, Sad and Qaf.
